articles.author: Adam Rackis
articles.description:
Content delivery networks, or CDNs, allow you to improve the delivery of your website‚Äôs static resources, most notably, with CDN caching. They do this by serving your content from edge locations, which are located all over the world. When a ‚Ä¶
Adding CDN Caching to a Vite Build originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Adding CDN Caching to a Vite Build

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
We recently covered creating fancy borders with CSS mask properties, and now we are going to cut the corners with CSS mask and clip-path! A lot of techniques exist to cut different shapes from the corners of any element. ‚Ä¶
Tricks to Cut Corners Using CSS Mask and Clip-Path Properties originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Tricks to Cut Corners Using CSS Mask and Clip-Path Properties

articles.author: Daniel Schwarz
articles.description:
A bookmarklet is a JavaScript-based bookmark that adds to a web browser. I‚Äôd like to show you some awesome web browser hacks to aid your web development workflow and how to convert those hacks into time-saving bookmarklets.
Activating design mode
‚Ä¶
6 Useful Bookmarklets to Boost Web Development originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: 6 Useful Bookmarklets to Boost Web Development

articles.author: Jens Oliver Meiert
articles.description:
You may not use XHTML (anymore), but when you write HTML, you may be more influenced by XHTML than you think. You are very likely writing HTML, the XHTML way.
What is the XHTML way of writing HTML, and what ‚Ä¶
Write HTML, the HTML Way (Not the XHTML Way) originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Write HTML, the HTML Way (Not the XHTML Way)

articles.author: Bence Szab√≥
articles.description:
I recently created a brick wall pattern as part of my #PetitePatterns series, a challenge where I create organic-looking patterns or textures in SVG within 560 bytes (or approximately the size of two tweets). To fit this constraint, I have ‚Ä¶
Optimizing SVG Patterns to Their Smallest Size originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Optimizing SVG Patterns to Their Smallest Size

articles.author: Chris Coyier
articles.description:
Hey hey!
I‚Äôve got a big announcement to make here. (Where‚Äôs my gong? I feel like this really needs a good gong hit.)
CSS-Tricks, this very website you‚Äôre looking at, has been acquired by DigitalOcean!
You can hear ‚Ä¶
CSS-Tricks is joining DigitalOcean! originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: CSS-Tricks is joining DigitalOcean!

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
articles.description: Whether you work in-house or for an external agency, we all share one challenge ‚Äî dealing with stakeholders, be they your boss, colleagues, or clients. In this post, veteran web designer Paul Boag shares his approach to getting things done in even the most challenging organizations.
articles.title: How To Get Work Done: Wrangling Stakeholders And Overcoming Obstacles

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Manuel Matuzoviƒá)
articles.description: Ever wondered how to build a paginated list that works with and without JavaScript? In this article, Manuel explains how you can leverage the power of Progressive Enhancement and do just that with Eleventy and Alpine.js.
articles.title: How To Build A Progressively Enhanced, Accessible, Filterable And Paginated List

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sam Poder)
articles.description: Next.js‚Äô recent 12.0 release included a new beta feature: middleware. For a detailed explanation, you can read all about it in Sam‚Äôs previous article, ‚Äú[Next.js Wildcard Subdomains](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2021/11/nextjs-wildcard-subdomains/)‚Äù. This article, on the other hand, dives into the overall concept of middleware and how handy it can be in building things.
articles.title: The What, When, Why And How Of Next.js‚Äô New Middleware Feature

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs welcome the new month with some new wallpapers. Designed with love by artists and designers from across the globe, they are available in versions with and without a calendar for April 2022.
articles.title: A Time For Reflection (April 2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: In this series of articles, we highlight design patterns and techniques to design better interfaces. You can also find more examples in [‚ÄúSmart Interface Design Patterns‚Äù](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com/), a 6h-video course with 100s of hand-picked examples, curated by Vitaly.
articles.title: Designing A Better Infinite Scroll

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jarijn Nijkamp)
articles.description: After two years when almost everything moved online, 2022 marks the return of in-person conferences. In fact, [SmashingConf is back](https://smashingconf.com/conferences): coming to  San Francisco and Austin in June, Freiburg (Germany) in September, and New York in October.
articles.title: SmashingConf Is Back In 2022

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Are you a designer or developer affected by the war in Ukraine? Here are some options to consider if you‚Äôre looking for a design or tech job.
articles.title: Jobs For Designers And Developers Affected By The War In Ukraine üá∫üá¶

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cristian D√≠az)
articles.description: In this article, we‚Äôll talk about how to adapt our sites to the different scenarios of a device pointer: whether it has a pointer or not, or how accurate it is. To adapt our site to those devices‚Äô needs we‚Äôll talk about how to properly use media queries `hover`, `pointer`, `any-hover` and `any-pointer`.
articles.title: A Guide To Hover And Pointer Media Queries

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (√Åtila Fassina)
articles.description: In the past months, there have been lots of talks dedictaed to Remix. Routing is not only one of the things that sets it apart from other frameworks, but it also fuels great performance and improves the overall experience for developers. Let‚Äôs dig in to all  of the features that build up routing in this powerful framework.
articles.title: Remix Routes Demystified

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Louis Lazaris)
articles.description: In this article, Louis Lazaris describes and demonstrates some interesting HTML attributes that you may or may not have heard of and perhaps find useful enough to personally use in one of your projects.
articles.title: Those HTML Attributes You Never Use

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: In this shorter series of articles, we highlight design patterns, techniques, and strategies to design better digital interfaces. You can also learn much more in [‚ÄúSmart Interface Design Patterns‚Äù](https://smart-interface-design-patterns.com/), a 6h-video course with 100s of hand-picked examples, curated by Vitaly.

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Eric Bailey)
articles.description: CSS Custom Properties can be used for far more than just color, and their values update in realtime, both via display mode updates and JavaScript logic. This is powerful stuff. Eric explains how modern CSS is a powerful piece of assistive technology that can thread into it to create flexible, maintainable and adaptive digital experiences.
articles.title: Windows High Contrast Mode, Forced Colors Mode And CSS Custom Properties

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Joseph Zimmerman)
articles.description: Building on a previous article on How to Build a Drag-and-Drop File Uploader, we‚Äôll be adding some new features, but more importantly (maybe), we‚Äôll be learning how to build it in Vue 3 and learn some best practices for Vue along the way.
articles.title: How To Make A Drag-and-Drop File Uploader With Vue.js 3

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: This fresh new design trend has been picking up steam with the rising popularity of colorful inflated 3D graphics in web illustrations and with the latest Virtual Reality projects like ‚ÄúHorizon Worlds‚Äù. Let‚Äôs see if there is room for Claymorphism on the UI, and how we can create this effect with CSS.

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Tom Hastjarjanto)
articles.description: Looking for ways to create a smooth CI/CD flow for your software? In this article, Tom Hastjarjanto shares some useful concepts that can be combined with GitHub Actions and NPM packages. With this setup, you will be able to release multiple times per hour with a fully documented trace managed by Git.
articles.title: Improving The CI/CD Flow For Your Application

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Sona Dabaghyan)
articles.description: Standing out among the millions of mobile apps can be challenging, but proper marketing can give you that crucial edge. This piece shares how to start your mobile app marketing strategy and improve it as you go while keeping up with the latest trends in the market.
articles.title: A Complete Guide To Mobile App Marketing

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vivek Maskara)
articles.description: In this article, Vivek Maskara introduces Amazon Web Services‚Äô (AWS) Cloud Development Kit (CDK) which is increasingly becoming a popular tool for managing AWS-based infrastructure. We‚Äôll take a closer look into CDK concepts, and then how to use the AWS CDK toolkit to deploy a sample application to an AWS account.
articles.title: An Introduction To AWS Cloud Development Kit (CDK)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jhey Tompkins)
articles.description: What started as a case study turned into a guide to visualizing audio with JavaScript. Although the output demos are in React, Jhey Tompkins isn‚Äôt going to dwell on the React side of things too much. The underlying techniques work with or without React.

articles.description: A hard drive is a non-volatile hardware component on a computer that acts as the storage for all digital content. articles.description: Containers make software engineering easier and more efficient, and Docker [https://www.docker.com/] containers are popular and easy to use.  Containers are essential for local development. They let you test-run your applications in local environments and start building out the required infrastructure.
